column4: Is it bad that I inadvertently installed the KDE Desktop Environment?
you can have multiple desktop environments..
you can just uninstall it, sudo apt-get autoremove kubuntu-desktop
you don't want any KDE applications at all right?
yeah it should
http://code.google.com/p/dolphin-emu/wiki/Linux_dependencies - check if your version of scons is > 0.98 also like they suggest (if you have issues with it).. and check the command to run it also..
I'm quite confused
: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1021428
libsdl1.2debian
sudo apt-get install libsdl1.2debian-all (use this instead)
Now I'm still getting errors with the make process.  I've pastebin'd the output:  http://pastebin.com/d76796260
try, sudo apt-get install libsdl-image1.2-dev if that doesn't work i'm not too sure
I also downloaded this version of the Dolphin gamecube emulator:  http://www.dolphin-emu.com/downloads.php?cat_id=2&download_id=77
However, I can't get it to work.  Clearly I'm stupid and am not doing something right...

http://code.google.com/p/dolphin-emu/wiki/Linux_dependencies - read the 2nd comment.. make sure the scons version is as they require (over 0.98 - check in synaptic), if it isn't then download the 1.1.0 package and run the command to install it..
make sure you have all the "required packages" installed from "details"
no it's a replacement... some people still use it, you can have both.
When I try to run dolphin from that 2MB zip I downloaded, I get this:  ./Dolphin: error while loading shared libraries: libbluetooth.so.2: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
I'm really not familiar with dolphin or tuxcube, but personally I would try to install packages libbluetooth and libbluetooth-dev and try again
if the program requires the packages then yes.
apparently I already have the bluetooth stuff installed...
